trans-unit.source: Waits for an instance of a named pipe to become available

seg-source.mrk: Waits for an instance of a named pipe to become available

target.mrk: Waits for an instance of a named pipe to become available

trans-unit.source: The name of the named pipe. The string must include the name of the computer on which the server process is executing.

seg-source.mrk: The name of the named pipe.
The string must include the name of the computer on which the server process is executing.

target.mrk: The name of the named pipe.
The string must include the name of the computer on which the server process is executing.

trans-unit.source: A period may be used for the servername if the pipe is local.

seg-source.mrk: A period may be used for the servername if the pipe is local.

target.mrk: A period may be used for the servername if the pipe is local.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The number of milliseconds that the function will wait for the named pipe to be available.

seg-source.mrk: The number of milliseconds that the function will wait for the named pipe to be available.

target.mrk: The number of milliseconds that the function will wait for the named pipe to be available.

trans-unit.source: You can also use one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: You can also use one of the following values:

target.mrk: You can also use one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: -1 - The function does not return until an instance of the named pipe is available

seg-source.mrk: -1 - The function does not return until an instance of the named pipe is available

target.mrk: -1 - The function does not return until an instance of the named pipe is available

trans-unit.source: 0 - The time-out interval is the default value specified by the server process

seg-source.mrk: 0 - The time-out interval is the default value specified by the server process

target.mrk: 0 - The time-out interval is the default value specified by the server process

trans-unit.source: If no instances of the specified named pipe exist the WaitNamedPipe function returns immediately.

seg-source.mrk: If no instances of the specified named pipe exist the WaitNamedPipe function returns immediately.

target.mrk: If no instances of the specified named pipe exist the WaitNamedPipe function returns immediately.
